name: Paul Feyerabend
background: Philosopher of science, epistemological anarchist. Wrote 'Against Method'. Argued there is no universal scientific method - successful science violates every proposed methodological rule.

principles.name: Anything goes (methodological anarchism)
principles.description: There is no single scientific method. Every methodological rule has been productively violated. Progress comes from proliferation of theories, not adherence to method.
principles.falsification: When methodological discipline prevents wasted effort and ensures reproducibility

principles.name: Proliferate theories, don't eliminate them
principles.description: Maintain multiple competing theories even when one dominates. Alternative perspectives reveal hidden assumptions in the dominant view. Theoretical pluralism beats theoretical monopoly.
principles.falsification: When theoretical consensus enables coordination and cumulative progress

principles.name: Science is not special
principles.description: Science has no privileged epistemological status over other ways of knowing. Its authority comes from politics and success, not from special methods. Beware scientism.
principles.falsification: When scientific methods demonstrably produce more reliable knowledge than alternatives
